Description: Blue/green glazed composition shabti of a god's father of Amun with painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face with the eyes traced in black, crossed arms in relief holding two black hoes, the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs, the foot section has broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
